summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services SHU (Special Housing Unit) review form for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, dated July 18, 2019. It notes he was in administrative detention, had no significant mental health issues, and was meeting with his legal team and had a court hearing that day, preventing a full review.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of the SHU review form, noted as being in administrative detention at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM).

persons.name: Elissa Miller
persons.context: The Bureau of Prisons psychologist who completed the SHU review form, noting she was unable to interview Epstein due to his legal meetings.

connections.description: Miller, as the Chief Psychologist, conducted the administrative review of inmate Epstein's status in the Special Housing Unit.

events.title: Epstein placed in SHU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed in the Special Housing Unit under administrative detention status.

events.title: Epstein's legal meetings and court hearing
events.description: Epstein was meeting with his legal team and had a court hearing, which prevented a psychologist from conducting his SHU review interview.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was in administrative detention in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (NYM) as of July 10, 2019.
A Bureau of Prisons psychological review on July 18, 2019, found Epstein had 'no significant mental health issues' and was a 'low' threat to self or others.
On July 18, 2019, Epstein was unavailable for his SHU review interview because he was meeting with his legal team and had a court hearing.
The document is a standard Bureau of Prisons administrative form, indicating routine monitoring of Epstein's status in custody.
